stimulusHtml: A two-sided t-test for a population mean is conducted of the null hypothesis H0 : Î¼ = 100. If a 90 percent t-interval constructed from the same sample data contains the value of 100, which of the following can be concluded about the test at a significance level of a = 0.10 ?
choicesHtml: The p-value is less than 0.10, and H0 should be rejected.
The p-value is less than 0.10, and H0 should not be rejected.
The p-value is greater than 0.10, and H0 should be rejected.
The p-value is greater than 0.10, and H0 should not be rejected.
There is not enough information given to make a conclusion about the p-value and H0.
